text: It's an RPG that's literally half Legend of Zelda, half Final Fantasy only anytime you find a treasure chest, you upgrade the game itself, such as getting new graphics, new NPCs or improving the game mechanics.
speaker: A

text: This is a brilliant idea with a lot of possibilities, but they aren't explored at all.
speaker: A

text: Because of this, the game will lacks any kind of depth, complexity or challenge.
speaker: A

text: Although there is one part we switch between two D and three D graphics to get past an area.
speaker: A

text: I like that I want to see more of that kind of stuff but the whole game is super charming with evolving from the past.
speaker: A

text: But the most it does with these ideas is making references to other iconic video games and it's super short.
speaker: A

text: Even with the extra stuff, you can beat it in under 4 hours.
speaker: A

text: I really wanted to see more.
speaker: A

text: The evolution idea is fantastic, but it's wasted on something, is trying to be nothing more than a parody making the game average at best.
speaker: A

text: Evil Land gets a five out of ten.
speaker: A
